io.confluent.ksql.serde

Interface Format

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AvroFormat, ConnectFormat, DelimitedFormat, JsonFormat, JsonSchemaFormat, KafkaFormat, NoneFormat, ProtobufFormat

    @ThreadSafe
public interface Format
    A Format is a serialization specification of a Kafka topic in ksqlDB. The builtin formats are specified in the FormatFactory class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods

    • Method Detail

      • name

        java.lang.String name()
        The name of the Format specification.

        As used for FORMAT, VALUE_FORMAT and KEY_FORMAT properties in SQL statements.

        Returns:
        the name of this Format

      • supportedFeatures

        default java.util.Set<SerdeFeature> supportedFeatures()
        Returns:
        The set of features the format supports.

      • supportsFeature

        default boolean supportsFeature(SerdeFeature feature)
        Parameters:
        feature - the feature to test
        Returns:
        true if the feature is supported

      • getSchemaTranslator

        default SchemaTranslator getSchemaTranslator(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> formatProperties)
        Get a type for converting between ParsedSchema returned by Confluent Schema Registry and ksqlDB's own schema types.

        If this Format supports the SerdeFeature.SCHEMA_INFERENCE feature, it is expected that this method will be implemented.

        Parameters:
        formatProperties - any format specific properties
        Returns:
        the converter
        See Also:
        SerdeFeature.SCHEMA_INFERENCE

      • validateProperties

        default void validateProperties(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> properties)
        If the format accepts custom properties in the WITH clause of the statement, then this will take the properties and validate the key-value pairs.
        Parameters:
        properties - the properties to validate
        Throws:
        KsqlException - if the properties are invalid for the given format

      • getSupportedProperties

        default java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getSupportedProperties()
        If the format accepts custom properties in the WITH clause of the statement, this method dictates which property keys are valid keys. This is used in conjunction with validateProperties(Map) to ensure that the format configuration is valid.
        Returns:
        a set of valid property names

      • getInheritableProperties

        default java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getInheritableProperties()
        Specifies the set of "inheritable" properties - these properties will persist across streams and tables if a sink is created from a source of the same format and does not explicitly overwrite the property.

        For example, if a stream with format DELIMITED was created with VALUE_DELIMITER='x', any DELIMITED sinks that are created with that stream as its source will also have the same delimiter value of x

        The default implementation of this method assumes that all of the supported properties are inheritable.

        Returns:
        the set of properties that are considered "inheritable"

      • getSerde

        org.apache.kafka.common.serialization.Serde<java.util.List<?>> getSerde(PersistenceSchema schema,
                                                                        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> formatProperties,
                                                                        KsqlConfig ksqlConfig,
                                                                        java.util.function.Supplier<io.confluent.kafka.schemaregistry.client.SchemaRegistryClient> srClientFactory,
                                                                        boolean isKey)
        Get the serde for the supplied schema.
        Parameters:
        schema - the schema of the data
        formatProperties - any format specific properties
        ksqlConfig - the session config
        srClientFactory - supplier of the SR client
        isKey - whether or not we're retreiving a key serde
        Returns:
        a serde pair capable of (de)serializing the data in this format.

      • supportsKeyType

        boolean supportsKeyType(SqlType type)
        Check whether given sql type is supported by this format.
        Parameters:
        type - given sql key type
        Returns:
        true if the given sql type is supported
